detaileddescription.para: Static class members

briefdescription.para: This function is used to enable acquisition on a Spin PIN with a given ADC.

simplesect.para: Not any pin can be used for acquisition: the pin must be linked to a channel of the given ADC. Refer to Spin pinout image for PIN/ADC relations.
This function must be called before Data API is started.

parameterdescription.para: Number of the Spin pin on which to enable acquisition.
Number of the ADC on which acquisition is to be done. This parameter can be omitted, in which case:

listitem.para: If only one ADC is linked to the given pin, it will be selected.
If two ADCs are available for acquisition on the given pin, the ADC with the lowest number will be selected.

detaileddescription.para:
0 if acquisition was correctly enabled, -1 if there was an error.
Errors generally indicate that the given pin is not linked to and ADC, and thus can not be used for acquisition.
If the adc_number parameter was explicitly provided, it can also indicate that the given ADC is not available for acquisition on the provided pin.
Public functions accessible only when using a power shield

briefdescription.para: This functions manually starts the acquisition chain.

detaileddescription.para:
If your code uses an uninterruptible task, you do not need to start Data Acquisition manually:
It will instead start automatically at the same time as the task as their internal behavior is intrinsically linked.

If, for some reason, you have an uninterruptible task in your code, but do not want the Scheduling module to be in charge of Data Acquisition, you need to indicate it when starting the uninterruptible task.
In that case, Data Acquisition must be manually started using this function.
Note that in that case, dispatch will use DMA interrupts which consumes a non-negligible amount of processor time and it is not advised.

Data Acquisition must be started only after ADC module configuration has been fully carried out.
No ADC configuration change is allowed after module has been started.
If you're using a power shield and are not sure how to initialize ADCs, you can use data.enableShieldDefaultChannels() for that purpose.

Data Acquisition must be started before accessing any data.get*() or data.peek*() function.
Other Data Acquisition functions are safe to use before starting the module.

0 if everything went well, -1 if there was an error Error is triggered when dispatch method is set to be external, but the repetition value has not provided.
Another source of error is trying to start Data Acquisition after it has already been started.

briefdescription.para: Checks if the module is already started.

para.verbatim:
For auto-spawning threads, this allows to make sure the module has already been started before trying to access measurements.
If you do NOT use (or do NOT know what are) auto-spawning threads:
- just make sure calls to any `data.get*()` or `data.peek*()` function occur after the uninterruptible task is started,
- or `Data Acquisition is manually started, and ignore this function.

simplesect.para: true is the module has been started, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Stops the module if it is started.

simplesect.para: 0 if everything went well, -1 if there was an error. Error is triggered when trying to stop Data API while it was not started.

briefdescription.para: Triggers an acquisition on a given ADC.

para.verbatim: Each channel configured on this ADC will be acquired one after the other until all configured channels have been acquired.

simplesect.para:
This function can NOT be called before: - at least one channel is enabled on the ADC
- AND the DataAPI module is started, (either explicitly or by starting the Uninterruptible task.)

parameterdescription.para: Number of the ADC on which to acquire channels.

briefdescription.para: Function to access the acquired data for specified pin.

para.verbatim: This function provides a buffer in which all data that have been acquired since last call are stored.

detaileddescription.para:
The count of these values is returned as an output parameter. The user has to define a variable and pass it as the parameter of the function.
The variable will be updated with the number of values that are available in the buffer.
This function can NOT be called before the pin is enabled. The DataAPI module must have been started, either explicitly or by starting the Uninterruptible task.
When calling this function, it invalidates the buffer returned by a previous call to the same function.
However, different channels buffers are independent from each other.

simplesect.para: When using this functions, the user is responsible for data conversion. Use data.convertValue() function for this purpose.
When using this function, DO NOT use the function to get the latest converted value for the same channel as this function will clear the buffer and disregard all values but the latest.

parameterdescription.para: Number of the pin from which to obtain values.
Pass an uint32_t variable. This variable will be updated with the number of values that are present in the returned buffer.

simplesect.para: Pointer to a buffer in which the acquired values are stored. If number_of_values_acquired is `0`, do not try to access the buffer as it may be nullptr.

briefdescription.para: Function to access the acquired data for specified pin.

para.verbatim:
This function converts all values that have been acquired since last call are stored and provide an array containing all of them.
The count of these values is returned as an output parameter.
The user has to define a variable and pass it as the parameter of the function.
The variable will be updated with the number of values that are available in the buffer.

detaileddescription.para:
This is an expensive function. Calling this function trigger the conversion of all values acquired since the last call.
If only the latest value is required, it is advised to call getLatestValue() instead.
If multiple values are required, but not all, it is advised to call getRawValues() instead, then explicitly convert required values using convertValue().
This function can NOT be called before the pin is enabled. The DataAPI module must have been started, either explicitly or by starting the Uninterruptible task.
When calling this function, it invalidates the array returned by a previous call to the same function.
However, different channels buffers are independent from each other.

parameterdescription.para: Number of the pin from which to obtain values.
Pass an uint32_t variable. This variable will be updated with the number of values that are present in the returned buffer.

simplesect.para: Pointer to an array in which the acquired values are stored. If number_of_values_acquired is 0, do not try to access the buffer as it may be nullptr.

briefdescription.para: Function to access the latest value available from a pin.

para.verbatim:
Values are expressed in the relevant unit for the data (Volts, Amperes, or Degree Celsius).
This function will not touch anything in the buffer, and thus can be called safely at any time after the module has been started.

simplesect.para: This function can NOT be called before the pin is enabled. The DataAPI module must have been started, either explicitly or by starting the Uninterruptible task.

parameterdescription.para: Number of the pin from which to obtain values.

simplesect.para: Latest available value available from the given channel. If there was no value acquired in this channel yet, return value is NO_VALUE.

briefdescription.para: This function returns the latest acquired measurement.

para.verbatim: Values are expressed in the relevant unit for the channel (Volts, Amperes, or Degree Celsius).

simplesect.para: This function can NOT be called before the pin is enabled. The DataAPI module must have been started, either explicitly or by starting the Uninterruptible task.
When using this functions, you loose the ability to access raw values using data.getRawValues() function for the matching channel, as data.getLatestValue() function clears the buffer on each call.

parameterdescription.para: Number of the pin from which to obtain values.

Pointer to an uint8_t variable. This parameter is facultative.
If this parameter is provided, it will be updated to indicate information about data.
Possible values for this parameter will be:
- `DATA_IS_OK` if returned data is a newly acquired data,
- `DATA_IS_OLD` if returned data has already been provided before (no new data available since latest time this function was called),
- `DATA_IS_MISSING` if returned data is NO_VALUE.

simplesect.para: Latest acquired measure for the channel. If no value was acquired in this channel yet, return value is NO_VALUE.

briefdescription.para: Use this function to convert values obtained using matching data.getRawValues() function to relevant unit for the data (Volts, Amperes, or Degree Celsius).

simplesect.para: This function can NOT be called before the pin is enabled.

parameterdescription.para: Number of the pin from which to obtain values.
Raw value obtained from the channel buffer.

simplesect.para: Converted value in the relevant unit. If there is an error, returns `-5000`.

briefdescription.para: Use this function to tweak the conversion values for the channel if default values are not accurate enough.

simplesect.para: This function can NOT be called before the pin is enabled. The DataAPI module must not have been started, neither explicitly nor by starting the Uninterruptible task.

parameterdescription.para: Number of the pin from which to obtain values.
Gain to be applied (multiplied) to the channel raw value.
Offset to be applied (added) to the channel value after gain has been applied.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t pin_num, float32_t r0, float32_t b, float32_t rdiv, float32_t t0)
memberdef.name: setConversionParametersNtcThermistor

briefdescription.para: Use this function to set the conversion values for any NTC thermistor sensor if default values are not accurate enough.

simplesect.para: This function can NOT be called before the sensor is enabled. The DataAPI must not have been started, neither explicitly nor by starting the Uninterruptible task.

parameterdescription.para: Number of the pin from which to obtain values.
The NTC resistance at a reference temperature.
The sensibility coefficient of the resistance to temperature.
The bridge divider resistance used to condition the NTC.
The reference temperature of the thermistor.

briefdescription.para: Use this function to get the current conversion parameters for the chosen channel .

simplesect.para: This function can NOT be called before the channel is enabled.

parameterdescription.para: Number of the pin from which to obtain values.
Paramater to be retrieved: gain or offset.

simplesect.para: Returns the value of the parameter. Returns `-5000` if the channel is not active.

briefdescription.para: Use this function to get the current conversion type for the chosen channel.

simplesect.para: This function can NOT be called before the channel is enabled.

parameterdescription.para: Number of the pin from which to obtain values.

simplesect.para: Returns the type of conversion of the given pin. Returns `-5` if the channel is not active.

briefdescription.para: Store the currently configured conversion parameters of a given channel in persistent memory.

parameterdescription.para: SPIN pin number

simplesect.para: 0 if parameters were correctly stored, negative value if there was an error:

briefdescription.para: Retrieved previously configured conversion parameters from persistent memory.

parameterdescription.para: SPIN pin number

simplesect.para: 0 if parameters were correctly retrieved, negative value if there was an error:

listitem.para: -2: persistent memory contains data, but its version doesn't match current version
-3: data in persistent memory is corrupted
-4: persistent memory contains data, but not for the requested pin

briefdescription.para: Set the discontinuous count for an ADC.

para.verbatim:
By default, ADCs are NOT in discontinuous mode.
Applied configuration will only be set when ADC is started. If ADC is already started, it must be stopped then started again.

detaileddescription.para:
This is an advanced function that requires to understand the way the ADC work.
Only for use if you explicitly requires it.

parameterdescription.para: Number of the ADC to configure.
Number of channels to acquire on each trigger event. 0 to disable discontinuous mode (default).

briefdescription.para: Change the trigger source of an ADC.

para.verbatim:
By default, trigger sources are:
- `ADC_1` and `ADC_2` = `TRIG_PWM`
- `ADC_3`, `ADC_4` and `ADC_5` = `TRIG_SOFTWARE`.
Applied configuration will only be set when ADC is started.
If ADC is already started, it must be stopped then started again.

parameterdescription.para: Number of the ADC to configure
Source of the trigger

briefdescription.para: Initialize all available ADC peripherals if not already initialized.

detaileddescription.para: This function configures each ADC with a default software trigger source and sets the adcInitialized flag to true.

briefdescription.para: Enable a specific ADC channel for sampling and DMA.

detaileddescription.para: Adds the channel to the ADC's active conversion list and tracks its rank.
ADC must not be started when enabling channels.

parameterdescription.para: Index of the ADC (15).
ADC channel number to enable (1N).

simplesect.para: 0 on success, -1 if invalid ADC/channel or ADC already started.

briefdescription.para: Disable a previously enabled ADC channel.

detaileddescription.para: Removes the channel from the conversion list of the given ADC.

parameterdescription.para: Index of the ADC (15).
Channel number to disable (1N).

briefdescription.para: Retrieve raw ADC conversion data for a specific channel.

detaileddescription.para: Returns a pointer to the buffer of raw values and updates the sample count.
Returns nullptr if API is not started or the channel is invalid.

parameterdescription.para: ADC index (15).
Channel number.
Reference to output number of samples.

simplesect.para: Pointer to raw ADC value buffer or nullptr on error.

briefdescription.para: Retrieve floating-point converted values for a specific ADC channel.

detaileddescription.para: Allocates and fills a buffer of converted values from raw ADC data.
May initialize internal buffers as needed.

parameterdescription.para: ADC index (15).
Channel number.
Reference to output number of samples.

simplesect.para: Pointer to converted float32_t values or nullptr on error.

briefdescription.para: Peek at the latest value sampled for the specified channel.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the latest available floating-point value, without affecting internal state.

parameterdescription.para: ADC index (15).
Channel number.

simplesect.para: Converted floating-point value, or NO_VALUE if unavailable.

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the latest sampled value for a channel and its validity status.

detaileddescription.para: If available, returns the most recent converted value.
Optionally updates a flag indicating if the data is fresh, old, or missing.

parameterdescription.para: ADC index.
Channel number.
Pointer to validity flag (optional).

simplesect.para: Latest converted value or NO_VALUE.

briefdescription.para: Get the conversion rank of a given ADC channel.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the rank used internally to track channel position in DMA acquisition.

parameterdescription.para: ADC index.
Channel number.

simplesect.para: Rank index (1N) or 0 if not active.

briefdescription.para: Get the ADC channel number mapped to a specific shield pin.

detaileddescription.para: Converts a shield pin number to the corresponding ADC channel.

parameterdescription.para: ADC index.
Pin number on the OwnTech shield.

simplesect.para: ADC channel number (1N) or 0 if invalid.

briefdescription.para: Return the default ADC assigned to a specific pin.

detaileddescription.para: Used to choose the preferred ADC in case multiple are supported.

parameterdescription.para: Shield pin number.

simplesect.para: Default ADC enum (ADC_1 to ADC_5 or UNKNOWN_ADC).

briefdescription.para: Return the ADC currently assigned to a specific pin.

detaileddescription.para: May differ from default if overridden by user logic.

parameterdescription.para: Shield pin number.

simplesect.para: Current ADC assignment or UNKNOWN_ADC.

briefdescription.para: Set the number of scheduling repetitions between data dispatches.

detaileddescription.para: Used by the internal scheduler to control how often data is pushed.

parameterdescription.para: Number of repetitions between dispatches.

briefdescription.para: Set the dispatch method for data acquisition.

detaileddescription.para: Determines if data is triggered internally or externally.

parameterdescription.para: Dispatch method enum value.

briefdescription.para: Force a full data dispatch cycle immediately.

detaileddescription.para: Pushes all currently acquired data through the dispatch mechanism.
Static class definition
